data.title: cmake codeblocks win32 mingw
data.body:
Hi Guys

I recently tried to build urho3d-1.5 on win7 using the cmake_codeblocks.bat file.

It fails in cmake_gui as well as in cmake command line. Do you have an update on this file for codeblocks compiling with mingw?

The script also uses vs2010 compiler, but doesn't give option to compile with mingw on windows.

Output on fail:


data.title: Models disappear when using game recording software
data.body:
I'm using Urho with OpenGL.
When turning on recording software that seems to use ogl/d3d API directly to minimize performing impact, models seems to disappear (UI, skybox and particle effects still visible).
This problem doesn't happen when using -gl2 command.

Example for software that causes this problem:
MSI Afterburner (rivatuner on-screen-display overlay)
LoiLo Game Recorder
Google Hangout (only with Windows 10?)

Example when using MSI Afterburner:
http://i.imgur.com/J2BPRBn.jpg
with gl2:
http://i.imgur.com/9QWevP5.jpg

(didn't test if it happens with Direct3D build)

data.title: Reordering UIElements in editor
The uniforms PSP_NEARCLIP and PSP_FARCLIP not sended properly into constant buffer (DX11)
data.body:
I trying add SoftParticels into DX11 shaders. 
and until this time I do not figure out - why SP works fine on GL shaders and not do not worked with same code algorithm on DX11.
and today I found this problem:

this works fine -> float diffZ = (depth - particleDepth) \* (1000 - 0.1); // 1000 = far  0.1 near from editor settings 
this not work -> float diffZ = (depth - particleDepth) \* (cFarClipPS - cNearClipPS);

I guessing something broken in sending uniforms

```
void View::SetCameraShaderParameters(Camera* camera, bool setProjection)
{
....
    graphics_->SetShaderParameter(VSP_NEARCLIP, nearClip);
    graphics_->SetShaderParameter(VSP_FARCLIP, farClip);
    graphics_->SetShaderParameter(PSP_NEARCLIP, nearClip); //<-This
    graphics_->SetShaderParameter(PSP_FARCLIP, farClip); // < and this
```

data.title: Extra NavigationMesh pathfinding options
data.body: This adds a new function to the `NavigationMesh` class to return flagged points. This allows waypoints in the calculated path to be recognized as off-mesh connections, for example; an AI-controlled character could perform a jump action, climb a ladder, or so on triggered by arriving at a special off-mesh connection.

data.title: Emitting particles as 3d geometry
data.body: Hi I am currently looking into emitting 3d geometry with the particle system in Urho3d. I can see that by default there are only sprites available. I am trying to fake it but it is quite slow especially on mobile. Would it be possible to make a feature request for this?

data.title: Urho3D Editor: Preview drag-moving rotation problem are fixed.
data.body:
The preview drag-moving did not work properly while you re-click the mouse button to rotate an object, it always reset the rotation to zero.

Fixed...

data.title: Made CrowdAgent emit events the attached Node as well
data.body:
Made CrowdAgent emit events from the attached Node as well as the
associated CrowdManager, to allow for simpler reaction of other
components on the same Node to crowd agent events.

data.title: Urho3D Editor: Preview drag-moving rotation problem are fixed.
data.body:
Hi, this is my first PR, if something wrong just correct me.

The preview drag-moving did not  work properly while you re-click the mouse button to rotate a object, it always reset the rotation to zero.

Fixed...

data.title: Merge pull request #2 from urho3d/master
data.body: Update from Urho3D

data.title: Added support for JSON scene and node loading, materials
data.body: As the title says. I basically went through all the load/save XML functionality for scenes and nodes (but not for the UI-specific XML loading) and replicated it to add scene loading and saving to and from JSON data.

data.title: Travis CI build for iOS 64-bit error due to maximum time limit has been reached
data.body: When performing a packaging build, the iOS 64-bit build script is instructed to perform a universal binary build. This increases the build time significantly and the job exceeds the time limit to generate and upload the build artifact.

data.title: AppVeyor build error caused by package installation timeout
data.body: When performing a packaging build, the build script is instructed to first install Doxygen and Graphviz from Chocolatey. However, it seems there is intermittent connection problem to Chocolatey which could cause the package installation to fail.

data.title: Added instantaneous rigidbody collision check
data.body: Added a `GetRigidBodiesInstantaneous` method (plus associated Lua/Angelscript APIs). This function is similar to `PhysicsWorld::GetRigidBodies` but actually performs an instantaneous collision check, instead of relying on cached collision data. This, for instance, allows for checks on static geometry that otherwise do not return the expected results.

data.title: Lights does not working in DeferredHWDepth (DX11)
data.body:
![123](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9577466/11626739/4aa5cc14-9d0f-11e5-9ff9-e497394b0f2c.png)

Yesterdays master DX11 renderer, std scene with cubes. Light's affects are not presented at all

data.title: GetRigidbodies doesn't work on static objects
data.body: As the title says; calling `GetRigidBodies` either directly through the `PhysicsWorld` component or indirectly through `RigidBody::GetCollidingBodies` does not return static rigidbodies. I'm attempting to get the rigidbodies in contact with a given `RigidBody` component set to be a trigger, and it only returns dynamic rigidbodies, not the static ground collider that I'm trying to detect. I know it is not a problem with my collision layers, masks, etc. as calling `GetRigidBodies` on the `PhysicsWorld` component with a sphere or box query returns the expected appropriate results.

data.title: Editor: set RenderPath for particle editor
data.body: It is necessary for custom RenderPath like Soft Particle http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic1611.html

data.title: Rendering artefacts when RenderPath = ForwardDepth
data.body:
(I tested only OpenGL build)

1) Start Editor
2) Editor settings
3) Render Path = RenderPaths/ForwardDepth.xml
4) Scene must be empty!
5) Some time move within the scene

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021826/11612515/03c1a1dc-9c16-11e5-8db8-0e0336c2dfb1.png)

data.title: Incorrect DDS cubemap loading
data.body:
To reproduce:

Create a DDS cubemap from face images (I use [DirectXTex](https://github.com/Microsoft/DirectXTex) for that):

```
Urho3D_Data/Textures> texassemble.exe -cube -f R8G8B8A8_UNORM -o BrightDay1.dds BrightDay1_PosX.dds BrightDay1_NegX.dds BrightDay1_PosY.dds BrightDay1_NegY.dds BrightDay1_PosZ.dds BrightDay1_NegZ.dds
```

Urho3D_Data/Textures/Skybox.xml:

```
<cubemap>
    <image name="BrightDay1.dds" />
</cubemap>
```

Run a sample, which uses this cubemap (23_Water, for example).
The cubemap is displayed incorrectly.
![urho_cubemap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1927992/11612126/6a26d70c-9c17-11e5-93a4-80d4f8261c0e.png)

data.title: Editor: Adding and removing user variables doesn't remove it from scenes "Variable Names" attribute.
data.body:
added user variable "userVar1" to a node via editor and removed it again. the variable name stays in scenes "Variable Names" attribute:

```
<attribute name="Variable Names" value="userVar1" />
```

found in release version 1.5

data.title: Better Networking (with SSL/TLS)
data.body: I am considering pulling kNet and Civitweb in favor of either Boost:ASIO or Botan so we can get SSL/TLS support. I need the SSL/TLS for a REST API that only works over a secure line (most of the good ones do). Are there any allergies to getting Boost or Botan in Urho3D? Both of these libs build for mobile so cross platform should be ok.

data.title: provide simple MIT licensed way to detect compiled 3D API
data.body:
Urho3D only supports one 3D API at a time.  That decision is made at compile time.  The documentation section "Shaders... API Differences" talks about the "D3D11" and "GL3" macros being defined according to the 3D API in use, but this is not actually true for consumers of Urho3D as a library.  Rather, URHO3D_D3D11 or URHO3D_OPENGL are passed as command line /D options to Urho3D's build.  They are not made readily available to any third party code.  One could incorporate pkg-config into one's project, but this is GPL V2 code and also a rather heavyweight requirement for someone just trying to get some Urho3D sample code going.  Culturally it may seem common on Linux to assume pkg-config is available and people know how to use it, but that isn't true on Windows and I have no idea on OSX.

It would be quite acceptable to have macros such as URHO3D_D3D11 or URHO3D_OPENGL actually defined in an Urho3D header file somewhere, and therefore available to consumers like the documentation actually says.  The advisability of this method, is related to the request for a general "configuration header" in #991.  Having only a single header for every macro, does tend to trigger massive rebuilds in real world projects when any option is changed.  It may be better to distribute such macros across the Urho3D header files that are actually relevant to them.

An example of real world need for this mechanism came up in https://github.com/gawag/Urho-Sample-Platformer/issues/14 .  I spent a few solid days tearing my hair out trying to figure out why the USP code didn't work on my system but did work on the developer's.  Lots and lots of debug tracing, looking at lots of resource paths that seemed to be loading ok, but were difficult to cover in their entireity.  Finally we learned about the debug log file and I noticed that lots of shaders had failed to load.  The dev was only providing GLSL shaders, and I had built my Urho3D for DX11.  Nothing in the build had warned me that this wouldn't work, and upon investigation, I see pkg-config is the only method by which such things would be known.

data.title: (FEATURE REQUEST) Writing all config definitions to Urho3D.h
data.body:
We can use COMPILE_DEFINITIONS for it: string (REPLACE ";"...
It allows users to manually create new projects without using CMake.

Also we can add libs to header file like

```
#if define(_MSC_VER)
#    if defined(_DEBUG)
#        pragma comment(lib, "Urho3D_d.lib")
#    else
#        pragma comment(lib, "Urho3D.lib")
#    endif
#endif
```

I think it's much easier to create new projects. Just create empty project in VS and include "Urho3D.h" in source file.

data.title: Add missing IntRect & IntVector2 getters and setters in XMLElement
crash after calling engine.Exit() if BackgroundLoader is loading resources
data.body:
how to reproduce:
1. modify the example script 38_SceneAndUILoad.as, change scene LoadXML to LoadAsyncXML
2. when the example windows shows up, quickly press ESC key.
   
   BTW: since the example scene "SceneLoadExample.xml" is not too resource heavy, you have to modify it a bit.

data.title: SpriteSheet2D alpha channel issue
data.body:
Hello,

I noticed when using a sprite near an alpha one and you try to tile it, you get a space between.
![tiling](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1329119/11449733/3b8a35a2-9581-11e5-8229-580bd81d00e8.jpg)

And instead, using one with no alpha sprites around it, works more or less but there is still a small background artifact.
![tiling2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1329119/11449737/717987da-9581-11e5-9d0d-fb4f0cac1cd3.jpg)

If using a single sprite works correctly. (Sprite2D)
![tiling3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1329119/11449743/bf092df2-9581-11e5-8ef2-6d0a7b14222e.jpg)

Noticed that in TmxFile2D too.

Here are testing sprites
https://www.dropbox.com/s/iy3xqbixhga9xu7/testing.zip?dl=0

Code

``` cpp
Node@ spriteNode = scene_.CreateChild("StaticSprite2D");
spriteNode.position = Vector3(i * 32.0f * PIXEL_SIZE, 0.0f, 0.0f);
StaticSprite2D@ staticSprite = spriteNode.CreateComponent("StaticSprite2D");
staticSprite.sprite = sprite.GetSprite("box0");
```

data.title: activated generation of class-index
data.body: it's common to have an alphabetical class index in the generated documentation. i think it would be helpful here too.
